content: Non-functional
replyContent: If you have time to call our Help desk (888-702-2227), please do so that we can gather more details about what you found Non-functional and try to get iBlueButton functional for you. Thanks a lot.

content: Terrible app! The UI is cluttered and isn't intuitive. I was hoping to use iBlueButton to link my VA medical records, but it's not any better than the VA's My HealtheVet website. Don't waste your time with this app.
replyContent: We are sorry that iBlueButton did not meet your expectations. If you have time to call our Help desk (888-702-2227) after the holidays, we would appreciate getting your specific feedback.

content: Great app. All my information from the VA is at my fingertips.
replyContent: Please call our support line at 888-702-2227 and we will try to help you get this fixed.

content: Had initial issues but support worked tirelessly until app was able to work. Allows easy download of va data. Allows to graph out your lab results over time. Easy access to your information sorted by categories. Exactly what I was looking for.
My favorite with this app: seeing an opioid warning for a pain medication I was prescribed for my back and had no clue I could get addicted to that!

Wow, this app just alerted me that one of the medications I take pits me at "higher risk for more severe coronavirus infection.". I thought that might be the case but it's nice to get this confirmation. Got some other drug warnings too that are super helpful. App is well laid out and makes things easy to understand.

I've been using this app for a few years with MyHealtheVet and with my Medicare records which nicely combines with all my prescriptions organized and listed in one place. I like the MedlinePlus button to research information like medication side effects. I noticed the recent update with the new VA records, with new labs section with the useful plot button to see graph displays and again that MedLinePlus info button which I found helpful to understand what these tests results means.

Really useful to have my VA health record combined with my Medicare Blue Button record. I sometimes see doctors outside the VA and didn't know until this app that I could get my different medical information in one place.
App won't even open anymore. Just says some error code and that there is a problem with the server. What is the deal!
replyContent: Thank you for taking the time to write this review.  We apologize that you have encountered this error.  Can you please call our customer support at (888) 702-2227 so that we can gather more information about your issue so that we can resolve it?

content: Works as advertised.
Great app to organize your medical information found on the Medicare website in Manage your Health.

After using iBlueButton for a couple of months I noticed it was not updating my information.  The Humetrix support team was friendly, responsive, and pro-active in addressing the issues I had with the app.  As I reported issues they fixed them promptly and genuinely seemed to appreciate my input.  IBlueButton is a useful app with the best customer support I've seen in years.
Using this app I found not one but two pretty huge errors in the information a doctor provided to Medicare, including a medication condition I never had. Recommend.
Really well done app and super easy to use. Helps make sense of medical jargon.

This was a total waste of my time. It ask for dates for things in your childhood that no one would ever remember to add it. It also does not have all the medications that I am taking. What is the deal of listing pharmaceutical companies for meds when people go to stores to get meds? Why not just list the med. This is a useless app and a Big waste of time.
replyContent: Thanks for your review. Dates for self-entered items and are optional.  For meds, we offer a comprehensive list.  Please contact our support (phone:  888-702-2227; email: ibb.support@humetrix.com) so we can help. The pharmaceutical company is included so if a drug is recalled, you can determine if the recall applies to your specific medication.

content: This has been so helpful in taking care of my Mom. It has been overwhelming at times and this app is a big help.
Amazing, I never thought I'd be able to get my medical information organized onto my phone, but this app does it.
Worth it for just the medication alerts, not to mention everything else.
An incredibly helpful app, turning medical jargon into insights I can understand.
Piece of mind app to have everything you need to remember to assist your loved ones.
So useful to keep track of my Mom's medications. Recommend if caring for an elder parent.
This app is of great help to keep track of and make sense of all the medications my dad takes.
As a vet and also on Medicare I found this app easy to use and very useful.
My gift for Mother's Day - downloaded the app to help my 88 year old Mom.

Helped my grand-aunt get this after seeing a demo of it at a caregivers conference here in San Diego. She is in her 80s and has lots of health issues, and this app is a big help to keep track of important medical details.

It's remarkable the level of medical information this app is giving me. I had hip surgery last year and through that one issue there are literally tons of info items related to the surgery and hospital stay, including the contact info of other doctors besides the hip surgeon.
Using now to carry my VA meds with me on my phone. I'm liking what I'm seeing.
Friend on Medicare told me about this app and it's for real. All my Medicare history in one place with helpful drug warnings. Super informational.

Just got this app and found several important medication warnings including one about a dangerous interaction between two drugs. I knew some of this but not all ... good to have these alerts. Also got to see list of all my doctors with their contact details. As a Medicare parient at Kaiser, this app gives me really useful information I cannot get using my Kaiser app.
Super helpful. Got my VA and Medicare records quickly and now have them both in one place.
As a vet and on Medicare have been using this and it's just great.
Helping my mom with all of her health issues and this app is amazingly helpful.
A must have for folks on Medicare. Getting my record was a breeze and I'm seeing lots of things I didn't even know about.
Nifty tool for organizing my health info. Really like the medication warnings.
Found out about this app on Medicare website and tried it out. Amazing that you can get such useful information from your Medicare record. Great app!
The medication alerts are very useful. Very pleased with the app
Great to see my Medicare record and be able to understand it!
Really like the medication warnings!
crashes more often than anything. With the new upgrades this app is unusable. Can I get a rollback?
replyContent: We are sorry that you experienced a crash with the new release. We have already found the issue you have reported and have fixed it and have posted a new build. It should be available within a few hours. Please download this new version and let us know if you experience any further issues. If so, we will address and fix ASAP.

content: Helping my older brother a disabled Vet also on Medicare I like this app combining all health information. Useful and straight forward to use.
Very impressed by the new update and and features.

As a physician caring for elderly parents on Medicare, I highly recommend that all of my colleagues taking care of Medicare patients let each of them know about this app. The medication alerts warning users of drugs which are often inappropriate for those over 65 and of dangerous drug-drug interactions combined with the detailed medical history provided will help ensure that patients receive safer care.

If you are on Medicare download this app! Amazing! It just warned me that a medication I just picked up at the pharmacy should not be taken with another medication I am on without speaking to my doctor first.
This is such a useful app for helping me and so many of my older friends to stay healthy. So easy to use. Great app!
Cant get past direct access setup. Keeps failing with java error. App is pure junk
replyContent: Please upgrade your app to iBlueButton 8.0 which has an easy to use onboarding flow to get set up.

content: Sounds like it would be a good app but not able to get past logg in page. Tried uninstall and reinstall but still nothing. Ugh.
replyContent: Please upgrade your app to iBlueButton 8.0. There is no login in the app and iBlueButton 8.0 incorporates an easy to use onboarding to get started, as well as many other new-and-improved features.

content:
Must have for veterans and physicians, I'm both. If there are any issues, I 
personally know the developers of this app will literally work very hard 
until a glitch in the system is fixed. 2.5 rating should be a 10.5.
Still not sure but the concept is a good idea. I will try it first
stinks
replyContent: Please upgrade to our iBlueButton 8.0 version where we have fixed all identified bugs and to which we added many more important medical safety functions

replyContent: Please upgrade to our iBlueButton 8.0 version where we have fixed all identified bugs and to which we added many more important medical safety functions

replyContent: Please upgrade to our iBlueButton 8.0 version where we have fixed all identified bugs and to which we added many more important medical safety functions.

content: app doesn't work at all
replyContent: Please upgrade to our iBlueButton 8.0 version where we have fixed all identified bugs and to which we added many more important medical safety functions.

content: Can't do anything and doesn't look like anyone is trying to fix it.
replyContent: Please upgrade to our iBlueButton 8.0 version where we have fixed all identified bugs and to which we added many more important medical safety functions.

content: Not impressed, and for those of you that think that it's an official VA app...IT'S NOT. For security reasons, they still haven't come out with one. Until they do, this is all we have.
replyContent: Please download the iBlueButton 8.0 version just released today. It has very useful medical safety warning features; it is also a very secure app only storing your data encrypted on your phone, not in the cloud. iBlueButton 8.0 has been approved by Medicare in 2018 for use by all Medicare beneficiaries after a thorough security and privacy review.

content: It doesn't work
replyContent: Please upgrade to our iBlueButton 8.0 version where we have fixed all identified bugs and to which we added many more important medical safety functions.

content: Garbage
replyContent: Please upgrade to our iBlueButton 8.0 version where we have fixed all identified bugs and to which we added many more important medical safety functions.

content: Can't get pass password.
replyContent: Please upgrade your app to the iBlueButton 8.0 version which has a much easier to use getting started process.

content: I have downloaded and installed this app 5 times and not once have I gotten past the initial password screen. This needs to be diagnosed and  fixed. Other wise it is a pointless time investment. I am a frequent and happy user of the my healthevet application on the web. Having your health records available when you see your doctor (while maybe not essential, it is terribly convenient). we
replyContent: All these set up ease of use issues have been fixed with the new iBlueButton 8.0 version. As a Veteran (also available to users on Medicare), you will also have access to important new safety alert features about your medications and conditions in our 8.0. Please upgrade when you have a chance.

content: App is always crashing when trying to download my information from the portal.  This is the whole point in downloading it so this is making it completely useless.  Please fix it!
replyContent: Please upgrade to our iBlueButton 8.0 version where we have fixed all identified bugs and to which we added many more important medical safety functions.

content: Wonderfull
Downloaded my record as pdf then offered to open it for me. Worthless app that doesn't do anything.
replyContent: Please upgrade to our iBlueButton 8.0 version where we have fixed all identified bugs and to which we added many more important medical safety functions.

content: Go to myhealthevet.gov and register. Put a shortcut on your device. If you want use LastPass for your password reminder. No need to submit your information to any outside source. It works all the time.
replyContent: Users of iBlueButton are not submitting any information to an outside source. Contrary to most other mobile apps, iBlueButton only stores data on the user’s phone or tablet to safeguard our users’ privacy. As a Veteran iBlueButton 8.0 - our latest version - will give you many other functions than the simple download of your MyHealtheVet record.

content: Application crashes when I try to enter information from the smartphone database (Contact list, etc.)
replyContent: This bug experienced on some Android phones has been fixed. Pleas upgrade to our latest release, iBlueButton 8.0 released today.I f you have a chance, please download the new 8.0 version which includes many important medical safety features.

content: This Application does NOTget ANY Records from the VA, for MyVAHealth. All it does is say ""authorizing, Downloading, authorizing, Downloading""  IT it was working, I am sure it would take no longer than 5 minutes to get the information from the VA.  Till this is Fixed,  I give this app a - (negative} 5 stars.  aka good for Crap,   I even tried to get in contact with the maker of this application, and NO ONE responds to any emails.  it sort of tells me, they cant fix it, or are un-willing to, or does not know how to fix the problem. just wanted to put something on here to make monies, then abandoned the app entirely, Just like a lot of app creators do... Sad actually, it would have been nice to have the records on my cell.   Again a - (negative} 5 stars
replyContent: Please upgrade to our iBlueButton 8.0 version where we have fixed all identified bugs and to which we added many more important medical safety functions.

content: The VA app is still in beta. (I know, because I'm in the beta.) Currently only VA employees can access the beta. All I can say is, it's still clunky, like most other apps I've looked at.
replyContent: Please try the new iBlueButton 8.0 upgrade released today. As a Veteran, you will be able not only download your VA Blue Button record like you can with the VA Blue Button app but also easily look up information and receive important medical safety warnings about your medications and conditions.

content: Won't load and keeps unexpectedly stopping and causing errors. I wish that somebody would do something right for us. 😭🔫
replyContent: Please try the new iBlueButton 8.0 upgrade released today. The bugs you are describing have all been fixed and the new version of the app provides many new useful safety features.

content: App does not get beyond "authorizing" for My health Vet. Have uninstalled and reinstalled several times
replyContent: Please upgrade to iBlueButton 8.0 released today

content: I've been using this site for over a year and it doesn't update or give the veteran test results as stated....it's just garbage and a big waste of time....just like the Va medical care system. We deserve better.
replyContent: When upgrading to iBlueButton 8.0, you will see all of your test results in your downloaded VA Blue Button record. Also in the new upgrade you will see important safety warnings regarding the medications you have been prescribed and very useful guidelines for medical conditions.

content: It still will not actually download any records. Uses Data like it's trying but 45 minutes later still nothing.
replyContent: Please upgrade to our iBlueButton 8.0 version where we have fixed all identified bugs and to which we added many more important medical safety functions.

content: Won't access tricareonline.  Unable to contact support as they filter all of those emails.
replyContent: iBlueButton 8.0 released today can let you download your TRICARE Blue Button record and incorporates many useful features. Please upgrade your app when you have a chance.

content: For over  half our tried retrieving  med records, but keeps  saying  looking  for  data/waiting for authorizing  over and over! :-/
replyContent: Please upgrade the app to its latest iBlueButton 8.0 version released today. Login to Blue Button portals have been very much improved especially thanks to the big update of of the MyMedicare.gov Blue Button 2.0 Blue Button portal.

content: Should have known it would be crap from there...wish I would have clicked the video before wasting my time!
replyContent: iBlueButton does not use any advertising within the app or in its new video which is now part of the newly released iBlueButton 8.0 app. If you have a chance, please download the new 8.0 version which have many important medical safety features.

content: Great Big Fizzle on VA performance.
replyContent: Please download the iBlueButton 8.0 released today where VA login issues have been fixed. The newly release app has also many new useful medical safety features for use by Veterans and other users.

content: Wouldn't login to Relay Health or Tricare.
replyContent: Please try our iBlueButton 8.0 upgrade released today. It does enable you to donwload your TRICARE Blue Button record. We have removed support though for Relay Health.

content: A QUICK and EASY Document review system for multiplatform Care Providers. My only link is : " My Health e Vet " and it allows Documented & Statistical Data Review without need to allow entry to my actual secure site. A very pleasingly designed Medical Portal Software Device.
Love It #1

First out of how many competitors?    Ripoff Alert... "In App" purchases is what this is about.  If its not right to charge Vets for downloading  their records, how is it ok to charge seniors? And further... $8 for a bundle of downloads? What unit of measure is a bundle? This is worse than the Obama Care website.   Another clue is, this company sells an app for $50, called the iGreen button that no one has ever downloaded (according to Google) and it is now in  version 2.0.  On the first place claim...  the gov  HHS Website says you came in second and GenieMD came in first, but the public only had 2 weeks to vote and then the public votes were only counted with a weight of 1/3.  So much for that claim and typical of the way Government does healthcare.
Could not get past blue button don't waste your time SUCKS BIG TIME
First time I tried using it. Crash!  Uninstalled.

Tried over 5 times to sign in. I  spent over an hour just trying to sign in. Followed all directions even got reset passwords. Followed all directions. Way to difficult. Does NOT work....Forget it. Sounded like a good thing DONE.
Supposed to link to my VA page or from my VA page to the app bit doesn't. Have to manually get files/feeds but deletes previous downloaded items.
Removed!
Worked fine before now after I paid to get unlimited downloads it just keeps me at the loading screen.
Not certified by the VA guys
Junk
replyContent: Please update with our latest iBlueButton 8.0 version just released today which fixed all found issues on Android phones. The new version has also many important new features with important medication and medical condition safety warnings.

content: Concept is awesome. Needs work

Downloaded and filled in info. The profile came up with double so I deleted one and they both deleted. So started over went to download portal and now they want $9.99 for unlimited download. Why should I pay for something that us free without this silly app!
**  VA & mefical  **

When entering the password to protect info in the app it does a force close crash on my samsung galaxy exhibit running android  4.1.  After doing some program diagnostics the crash was the result of a  conflict with my swiping keyboard app called swype keyboard. The keyboard app causes the force close crash.

It is very difficult to get the app installed on my smartphone.  When the install worKS it is easy to sign.  After that the App is impossible tobuse.  I have NEVER been able to download my records ONCE.  NO OTHER FEATURES HAVE EVER WORKED FOR MR. I TRY ABOUT ONCE EVERY THREE WEEKS.  SYSTEM NEEDS TO STAR A REBUILD FROM SCRATCH
I've tried to do some things with this app today and it keeps telling me that the app has stopped working.

This app seems to work fine as far as downloading my VA medical records. However, it doesn't save any info; neither reports I've just downloaded nor my personal info I just input. If I try to add my personal info from my card, the app crashes consistently.

Doesn't appear to save any info.  Cannot even get past create a new profile.  Each update seems worse.  I have an authenticated account, and have successfully downloaded my Blue Button records to a PC numerous times over the past few months.  Would be a great app if it worked.

Tried it since it was updated just yesterday (wanting to stay away from old junk). It won't retain the portal information, at least for VA.  I'd put it on and save but it would erase it and all again.  I used the same info to log on to actual site with no problems.  Maybe VA has changed their portal access or something.  I am a MHV coordinator so I'd love for this to work.  Update...working perfect now!
I've uninstall and reinstalled 2x. Unable to email record to anyone. Please fix or tell me how to fix it.
It saved profile but keep crashing when I tried to access site....it also doesn't auto rotate so I can use keyboard
Really interesting app and well done actually.  Love having the ability to access all my medical records wherever I go.  The med look-ups are tidy, and it's very helpful to get more info on my meds.
Great app! Much easier to keep track of my medical records now!

I will definitely have to download this on my mom's phone and download her Medicare record's. Made managing and accessing and all my past medical information so much easier. Very satisfied, and recommend to all.
Much more user friendly view of his Medicare record than on their website.
It will be really convenient having all of my medical information with me and at my fingertips when I travel.

Finally an alternative to all those papers and files that are stacking up in a box. The app works great. After the initial setup, it was easy to input my entire family's medical info. I am definitely going to talk to my doctor about using ibluebutton.

Using this app, I can take care of  tracking my parents medical history downloaded from Medicare. Easy to look up information about their medications and conditions. Another great feature is that I can get contact information for every doctor that has taken care of my parents in the last 3 years!
Can't save any info.  Uninstalled

This app does nothing. Can't set up or get my blue button records from va. I thing that they are just collecting persons info for illegal gains. Can't save snyting. Doesn't even deserve a star but can't go lower.  Going to contact my senator to see if they are getting any go Vermont fund and get that stopped. How can they say they are best winning app.
HTC one max

It's a bit of work to set up. If you have an account with the VA or SSA, once you enter & verify who you are, the info should just populate itself; not hand enter everything. There's a memo pad app for that.
Great potential, but the app won't save my personal information so that makes it completely useless. Uninstalled.

I am an Army Veteran. I have a poor connection at home. I was pleasently surprised when I found this app.  However, no matter what I do, it refuses to save my portal. End result, wasted space on my phone.

I installed the app on my Android phone, don't recall setting a password, but it asks me for one now. I click on "Forgot Password" and am asked a security question. I answer the question and it prompts me, "Error. Please enter correct passphrase." I presume that I know my mother's maiden name!  What do I do now? can I initialize and start over?
Not ready But what you would expect from a government product.

I applaud the VA for launching the entire Blue Button Program.   The App is rather inmature and Will take a lot of sweat equity to bring it up to professional standards.   During my first use the App crashed entirely too much.

After entering my personal information using my Android, it erased all my information.  Then after painstakingly entering my very long password for MyHealthevet, it did nothing.  I was not able to access my records even though I was already logged in.  Going from one screen to another always required me to have to log in again.  This is worthless.  Logins should remain active until logging out.  Having to keep logging in is annoying.  Not being a texting person and new to smartphones, I prefer to use this on my PC where I know it will be secure.  I can already download my medical records from the VA, but for some reason cannot get it in a PDF format anymore.  I'll keep doing it the old way.
replyContent: Once you enter the MyHealtheVet credentials in our app, you should not have to enter them again. And the iBB-app password request only happens after 5 mins of inactivity. Please call our support line & we can help you with everything and tell you about our security: (888) 702-2227. And please download our new update, out last night, with new help.

content: A friend told me this app became available on Android and it let's me get my medical records right down to my phone. He was right.  Works great!
